actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans Affairs.

official_title: A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to improve benefits for Filipino veterans of World War II, and for other purposes.
short_title: Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 1999

summary.text: Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 1999 - Authorizes payment of compensation for the service-connected disability of members of the Philippine Commonwealth Army who served with U.S. armed forces during World War II in the amount of one dollar for each dollar authorized, as long as each such individual resides in the United States and is a U.S. citizen or an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence. Directs the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to furnish hospital and nursing home care and medical services to such veterans and new Philippine Scouts in the same manner as furnished to U.S. veterans. Directs the Secretary to furnish care and services to veterans, Commonwealth Army veterans, and new Philippine Scouts for the treatment of service-connected disabilities and non-service-connected disabilities of such veterans and scouts residing in the Republic of the Philippines on an outpatient basis at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic. Limits to $500,000 the amount to be expended during a fiscal year for such services.

titles.title: Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 1999
A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to improve benefits for Filipino veterans of World War II, and for other purposes.
